definition: to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to tread on/to trample/to stamp/to fulfill/Taiwan pr. [dao4]
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: In an effort not to repeat the same situation with their own children, they have few rules.
sentences.chinese: 爲了不使孩子重蹈覆轍，他們很少給孩子立規矩。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you are doomed to repeat it.
sentences.chinese: 否則，你就註定會重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: I made a blunder, and I tell myself that I'll never make that mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 我犯了個大錯，我告訴自己絕不會再重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: In this context, history could repeat itself in the Arab World.
sentences.chinese: 以此類推，阿拉伯世界有可能重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: We made the mistake of romanticizing villages, and we don't need to make that mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 我們錯誤地把鄉村浪漫化，我們不要再重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: Acknowledge your role in it so you can avoid repeating it.
sentences.chinese: 承認你對婚姻失敗負有責任，從而避免重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: To reGREt one’s errors to the point of not repeating them is true repentance.
sentences.chinese: 反思自己的過錯以至於不重蹈覆轍纔是真正的悔悟。

sentences.english: It should be clear to everyone that we will not repeat the mistakes of the past.
sentences.chinese: 大家應當清楚，我們不會重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: Who can guarantee that we won’t repeat our previous mistakes?
sentences.chinese: 誰敢保證在這件事情上我們不會重蹈覆轍？

sentences.english: Old McDonald gave up smoking for a while, but soon returned to his old ways.
sentences.chinese: 老麥克唐納戒了一段時間煙，但不久又重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: By learning about these pitfalls now, you will be able to avoid them in the future.
sentences.chinese: 現在學習到這些缺陷可以避免你在今後重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: He who does not learn from history dooms to repeat it.
sentences.chinese: 不向歷史學習的人註定要重蹈覆轍。

sentences.english: The system is accident-prone, but it rarely makes the same mistake twice.
sentences.chinese: 金融系統容易發生意外，但它很少重蹈覆轍。

definition: to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
